alert.note: Alert for Cass; Kosciusko; Miami; Wabash; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:41PM EST until February 20 at 9:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. Eel River at North Manchester affecting Cass IN, Miami, Wabash, Whitley and Kosciusko Counties. Yellow River at Plymouth affecting Marshall, Starke and St. Joseph IN Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Wabash, Huntington, Blackford, Wells and Jay Counties. Wabash River near Bluffton IN affecting Wells County. Wabash River at Wabash affecting Cass IN, Miami and Wabash Counties. Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. Kankakee River at Davis affecting Starke, La Porte and St. Joseph IN Counties. .These river rises will shift ice within the river and could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eel River at North Manchester. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters approach businesses and homes on South Mill Street. At 15.5 feet, Significant flood problems in southwest Whitley and northeast Wabash Counties along the Eel River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EST Thursday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
